text: New paper! Shatha Alqurashi (PhD co-supervised by Sinead, main supervisor Richard Wall) published the first paper from her PhD on the nutritional requirements for survival and reproduction in the blowfly, Lucilia sericata
Antoine and Sinead hosted Lauren Cator (Imperial College) for a seminar visit in Bristol
Sinead gave a plenary at the ASAB Winter Meeting
Sinead gave a seminar at the University of Lausanne (hosted by Ornela de Gasperin)
Welcome to new lab members, Hester Weaving (BBSRC SWBio PhD), Molly Beastall (MRes) and Lauren Marchant (MRes)!

Sinead spends a few days with the Developmental Evolutionary Ecological Psychology lab and gives a seminar at the Behavioural Science Institute on “The long arm of early-life effects” (Radboud University, Nijmegen)

Sinead presents work on stress and breastfeeding at the Society for the Study of Human Biology annual meeting (Oxford Brookes) and the Mechanisms and Evolution of Intergenerational Change conference (Wellcome Genome Campus, Cambridge)

New paper! Antoine has published results from his previous postdoc on malaria control (Penn State University, USA), involving months of release recaptures with fantastic volunteers in Ivory Coast to explore the cumulative effects of a 'Lethal House Lure' on malaria mosquitoes mortality
Antoine gives talk on modelling tsetse-borne disease at the IDDConf in Cumbria, UK
New paper! Sinead and Mike Bonsall (MERG, Oxford) have published a study in Ecology & Evolution, linking cellular dynamics with life history outcomes
John Hargrove visits Bristol to discuss the BBSRC project and related tsetse work
Gabby di Pol (BBSRC-STARS summer student) has joined EVE Lab for 2 months working on trypanosome coinfections, with Lori Peacock and Wendy Gibson
Sinead gives a research seminar at the University of Aberdeen (hosted by Julien Martin)
Sinead visits Marshall McCue at Sable Systems International (Las Vegas, USA) to discuss measuring isotopes in tsetse breath
Antoine attends the African sleeping sickness meeting in Warwick organised by our collaborator Kat Rock (HAT MEPP project)
Antoine and Sinead attend the annual BBSRC Reproductive Senescence project meeting at LSTM in Liverpool
